derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from medieval Latin, from Old Italian tarantola 'tarantula', from the name of the seaport Taranto. Compare with tarantella and tarantism

encyclopedia.content: 塔兰图拉 英音：[tə'ræntjulə]美音：[tə'ræntʃələ] 名词n. 【动】 1.捕鸟蛛 2.狼蛛 也作多毛毒蜘蛛。

entry.def: A tarantula is a large hairy spider which has a poisonous bite.

means.word_mean: 1. large southern European spider once thought to be the cause of tarantism (uncontrollable bodily movement)
2. large hairy tropical spider that can inflict painful but not highly venomous bites
